text:
Good morning Svenja.
The programming language topic is a very interesting one. It's quite easy to answer what where using and why we're using those languages but that doesn't mean they are the _best_ languages. There are reasons for us to use those languages (I'll explain later) but in other areas, there are other languages which are more suitable.

So let's start easy: we mainly use python and C++. Python for simpler scripting (easier, faster to write), C++ for all the performance critical tasks. I'm working in the R&D department and we're mostly working on fundamental problems which are very general and crucial performance tasks. So we mainly use C++. On the show side (developers working more closely with artists and specific shows), it's more python.
Both languages are popular languages but there are areas (e.g. web) where they aren't really relevant.
Do you have any programming experience?

Your profile said you're interested in the medical and technology industry. Do you have a concrete job in mind? I can talk about programming languages for quite a while but only if that helps you. Otherwise, there are many more things to talk about technology and career steps.
